citation.article-title: Constrictibacter antarcticus gen. nov., sp. nov., a cryptoendolithic micro-organism from Antarctic white rock
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Constrictibacter antarcticus sp. nov.
Constrictibacter antarcticus (ant.arc′ti.cus. L. masc. adj. antarcticus pertaining to Antarctica).
Cells are 0.8–1.0 µm in diameter and 1.5–2.0 µm in length.
Colonies are white and circular, <0.2 mm in diameter on 0.25×LB/MA agar.
Catalase is produced, but oxidase is not produced.

Produces acid phosphatase, alkaline phosphatase, cystine arylamidase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), β-glucosidase, leucine arylamidase, lipase (C14), naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, trypsin and valine arylamidase.
Complex nutrients (tryptone or yeast extract) are essential for growth.
Grows at 5–30 °C (optimum 25 °C) and pH 6.0–8.0 (optimum approximately pH 7.0).
Doubling time is about 36 h in 0.25×LB/MA medium under optimal growth conditions.
Ribose, fructose, lactose, sucrose, trehalose, glycerol, glycolate, malate, acetate, succinate, pyruvate, aspartate and glutamate support cell growth.

The type strain is resistant to erythromycin, lincomycin, pristinamycin, tylosin, cotrimoxazole, sulfamethizole, nitrofurantoin, fusidic acid, metronidazole, penicillin, amoxicillin, oxacillin, cephalothin, cefoperazone, chloramphenicol and tetracycline, but sensitive to colistin, flumequine, oxolinic acid, enrofloxacin, rifampicin, amoxicillin/clavulanic acid, streptomycin, spectinomycin, kanamycin, gentamicin, apramycin and doxycycline.
The type strain, 262-8T ( = JCM 16422T = ATCC BAA-1906T), was isolated from a cavity within white rock collected in the Skallen region of Antarctica.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 69.8 mol%.
